text.section:
An individual is not ineligible under the Program solely because Social Security benefits received by the individual are increased, unless:
The individual is considered ineligible because of the increase under applicable rules or regulations of the United States Department of Health and Human Services; and
As to that individual, federal matching funds for the State Program are not available.

Except as provided in § 15-103(a)(2)(ii) of this subtitle, to determine eligibility under the Program, the Department annually shall set the allowable yearly income levels in amounts at least equal to the following:
Family of 1 - $2,500.
Family of 2 - $3,000.
Family of 3 - $3,500.
Family of 4 - $4,000.
Family of 5 or more - $4,500 plus an increase of $500 for each family member in excess of 5.
This section is effective only to the extent that its provisions do not conflict with federal requirements for the administration of the Program in this State.

As a condition of eligibility for medical assistance, a recipient is deemed to have assigned to the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene or the Secretary's designee any rights to payment for medical care services from any third party who has the legal liability to make payments for those services, to the extent of any payments made by the Department on behalf of the recipient.

section.section: Each resident of a nursing home who is a recipient of medical assistance shall receive a personal needs allowance.
After a determination of income eligibility is made for a nursing home resident under the Program, the personal needs allowance shall be deducted from the total income of the resident.

If on or before June 30, 2002, the federal Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services approve the Department's application for an amendment to the State's existing § 1115 demonstration waiver necessary to implement the Maryland Pharmacy Discount Program established under § 15-124.1 of this subtitle:
If on or before June 30, 2002, the federal Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services do not approve the Department's application for an amendment to the State's existing § 1115 demonstration waiver necessary to implement the Maryland Pharmacy Discount Program established under § 15-124.1 of this subtitle:
The Secretary shall adopt regulations to implement this subsection.

text.section: Subject to the confidentiality requirements of State and federal law, the courts of this State shall admit a certified copy of a 206N form, also known as a long-term care transaction form, into evidence.
